Lyrics: Asia felice hor ben posso chiamarmi
Poetic Translation: I, Asia, justly call myself contented;

Lyrics: Ch’è vint’in mar di me l’empio nemico.
Poetic Translation: At sea my enemy now is defeated.

Lyrics: Ma più sarò quando con gaudio l’armi
Direct Translation: See Mick Swithinbank's work at Choral Public Domain Library.
Poetic Translation: But joy will come when, with glad arms presented,

Lyrics: De’ figli miei faransi ogn’un amico.
Poetic Translation: My sons have all the world in friendship greeted.

Lyrics: Et io più all’hor felice Affrica piene
Poetic Translation: I, Africa, am happier, as flooded

Lyrics: Havrò di frutti e fior l’aride arene
Poetic Translation: With fruits are fertile lands, Nature's successes,

Lyrics: E, per campagne più che mai feconde
Poetic Translation: And flowing through the fields with flowers studded,

Lyrics: Porterà il Nilo al mar d’argento l’onde.
Poetic Translation: Unto the silver sea the Nile progresses.

Lyrics: Felice Europa anch’io godo non meno
Poetic Translation: I, Europe, revel, joy no less than my neighbors,

Lyrics: Che più che mai con gloriose prove
Poetic Translation: In forceful charm and glory undivided.

Lyrics: Hor sotto un vero Dio, non falso Giove
Poetic Translation: With God, not Jove of pagans, to spur my labors,

Lyrics: Havrò del mond’ un’ altra volta il freno.
Poetic Translation: I take the world now in my hand and guide it.
